qas.question: What two northern Vietnamese cities did the US avoid bombing at the outset of the war?
What was the major supply trail for the Northern Vietnamese forces?
What US commander's strategy caused a loss of public opinion in the US?
Who helped orchestrate bombing campaigns in the Vietnam War?
When did the US start bombing Hanoi?
What two northern Chinese cities did the US avoid bombing at the outset of the war?
What was the minor supply trail for the Northern Vietnamese forces?
What US commander's strategy caused a loss of public opinion in the UK?
Who helped orchestrate bombing campaigns in the Chinese War?
When did the UK start bombing Hanoi?

context: The military history of the American side of the war involved different strategies over the years. The bombing campaigns of the Air Force were tightly controlled by <a3_0><b8_0>the White House<b8_0/><a3_0/> for political reasons, and until <a4_0><b9_0>1972<b9_0/><a4_0/> avoided the main Northern cities of <a0_0><b5_0>Hanoi and Haiphong<b5_0/><a0_0/> and concentrated on bombing jungle supply trails, especially <a1_0>the <b6_0>Ho Chi Minh Trail<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The most controversial Army commander was <a2_0><b7_0>William Westmoreland<b7_0/><a2_0/> whose strategy involved systematic defeat of all enemy forces in the field, despite heavy American casualties that alienated public opinion back home.
